FAIL_TO_PASS: when unknown command and showSuggestionAfterError() then show suggestion
when program has value/no flag specified with value then specified value
when specify unknown option with simple program then error
when cli of cart and commands ["camb","cant","bard"] then suggest cant because only closest of different edit distances
when missing command-argument then shows help
when specify unknown option with subcommand and action handler then error
when global option then candidate for subcommand option suggestion
when program has subcommands and specify only unknown option then display help
when cli of --cat and options ["--at"] then suggest --at because 1 deletion
when unknown command then error
when cli of --bat and options ["--cat"] then suggest --cat because 1 substitution
when command has required value specified using env then no error and option has specified value
when has conflicting option then throw CommanderError
when program has required option not specified and subcommand --help then help
when help on program then context.command is program
when default writeErr() then error on stderr
when default help option then --help is candidate for suggestion
when program has option with name different than property then still recognised
when cli of xat and commands ["rat","cat","bat"] then suggest bat, cat, rat because sorted possibles
should report correct error for negated env variable when positive is configured
